content: you know the gauge you can make these mitts to approximately the last knuckle of your middle i ve just saved you a ton of purling yay from any yarn finger i used 1 inch for the thumb opening but you could safely go a bit bigger depending on how deep 7 join and knit the fingers gauge 8 sts/inch on size 2 5 needles your thumb is just that join in the round and start knitting in cast on 64 to 72 sts stockinette until you are about 1/4 inch away from create 1 to 2 inch cuff then knit in stockinette until 5 inches add the finger length and the depth of your thumb completing c inches you can create another knit/purl back & forth for about an inch then turn inside out and subtract that from your forearm length this k2p2 or garter edge i did a garter edge purling one join in the round again continue to knit stockinette for 3 75 inches gives you the length of your cuff plus hand length row knitting one row and binding off purlwise knit 1/4 inch cuff fold over weave in your ends taking particular care to hide this pattern is for your personal non-commercial use only you are not allowed to make the end at the tips of your fingers fold over the fin- or mass produce this pattern or garments from this pattern for sale anywhere © 2013 ger cuff so that there is no stockinette showing maire martin all rights reserved http //inkyblack net http //stringchronicity net
